decks.notes: The main concept of this deck is to control the game with disruptive spells and creatures, while cycling through cards to quickly fill up the graveyard. By utilizing cards like Street Wraith and Generous Ent to cycle through the deck, the goal is to eventually cast Living End to bring back a large number of creatures from the graveyard and overwhelm the opponent. The deck includes various creatures and spells that can be cycled or cascaded into to further the game plan of quickly filling the graveyard and setting up for a powerful Living End.

The main idea of this UW Control deck is to control the game by utilizing counterspells, removal spells, and board wipe cards like Terminus. The deck also includes powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Teferi, Time Raveler to generate card advantage and control the tempo of the game. The deck aims to slow down the opponent's threats while setting up its own win conditions, such as using Isochron Scepter with Orim's Chant or utilizing powerful creatures like Solitude. The companion, Kaheera, the Orphanguard, provides additional flexibility and synergies with the deck's game plan.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy through control elements like Blood Moon and Malevolent Rumble, while also ramping up mana quickly with cards like Utopia Sprawl and Arbor Elf. The goal is to maintain board control and tempo through efficient removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Bonecrusher Giant, and to outvalue the opponent with powerful threats like Fanatic of Rhonas and Endurance. Karn, the Great Creator provides additional utility and disruption options, while Fable of the Mirror-Breaker can snowball into a win condition if left unchecked.

The deck focuses on generating mana quickly through rituals and medallions to cast powerful spells like Ral, Monsoon Mage and Glimpse the Impossible, while utilizing cards like Wrenn's Resolve and Wish to manipulate the top of the deck. It aims to set up a critical turn where it can chain multiple spells together to deal a large amount of damage, often utilizing cards like Grapeshot or Past in Flames to finish off the opponent in a single turn. The deck thrives on explosive plays and careful planning to maximize its combo potential.

This deck focuses on utilizing the Amulet of Vigor to generate additional mana to quickly ramp up and play your powerful lands, such as Urza's Saga and Primeval Titan. By using cards like Crumbling Vestige and Green Sun's Zenith, you can search for the necessary pieces to set up a devastating combo with cards like Scapeshift and Boseiju, Who Endures. With careful planning and proper sequencing of your land plays, you can overwhelm your opponent with massive creatures and land triggers to secure victory.

The deck focuses on quickly deploying aggressive creatures like Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer. It also utilizes disruptive cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Prismatic Ending to control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck is flexible, being able to switch between aggro and control depending on the situation. It also has access to powerful removal spells like Solitude and Wrath of the Skies to deal with threats. The overall strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures while disrupting their plans.

The deck focuses on utilizing instant reanimation spells like Goryo's Vengeance to cheat out powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Emperor of Bones from the graveyard. The combo potential is further enhanced by cards like Ephemerate and Faithful Mending to dig for combo pieces and protect key creatures. Interaction is provided through cards like Solitude and Force of Negation to disrupt opponents' game plans. The deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces and overwhelm opponents with powerful, hard-to-interact-with threats while controlling the game state.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while generating incremental advantage with cards like Narset, Parter of Veils and Teferi, Time Raveler. By efficiently answering threats and denying the opponent resources, the deck can slowly take over the game and establish a dominant position. Key cards like Solitude and Consult the Star Charts provide flexibility and options in various situations, allowing the deck to adapt to different matchups.

The deck focuses on applying early pressure with low-cost creatures such as Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Quantum Riddler, while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Solitude and Consign to Memory. Phage, Titan of Fire's Fury serves as a powerful finisher, and control elements like Prismatic Ending and Spell Snare help to keep the opponent in check. The deck also includes card advantage and recursion options like Ephemerate and March of Otherworldly Light, allowing for flexibility in different matchups. The goal is to quickly overwhelm the opponent while disrupting their strategy to secure victory.

This deck focuses on using Allosaurus Rider along with Eldritch Evolution and Neoform to quickly search out and play powerful creatures like Griselbrand, Ghalta, and Atraxa. It also includes various cards to protect the combo and disrupt the opponent's strategy, such as Pact of Negation and Veil of Summer. The deck aims to ramp up its mana quickly and overwhelm the opponent with large creatures, while also utilizing cards like Planar Genesis and Consign to Memory for additional value. The inclusion of Xenagos, God of Revels and Boseiju, Who Endures provide additional versatility and power to the deck.

This deck focuses on using Allosaurus Rider along with cards like Eldritch Evolution and Neoform to quickly bring out powerful creatures like Griselbrand, Ghalta, and Xenagos. The deck also includes cards like Veil of Summer and Pact of Negation to protect the combo pieces and ensure the opponent can't disrupt the combo. By combining ramp, tutors, and protection spells, the deck aims to go off quickly and overwhelm the opponent with a powerful board presence that can close out the game in a few big swings.

The deck focuses on utilizing aggressive creatures like Emperor of Bones and Overlord of the Balemurk to quickly pressure opponents while disrupting their game plan with cards like Solitude and Thoughtseize. Flickerwisp and Ephemerate provide additional value by reusing enter-the-battlefield effects. Teferi, Time Raveler helps protect your board and disrupt opponents' instant-speed plays. The deck also includes removal spells like Fatal Push and Prismatic Ending to deal with threats. Witch Enchanter and Quantum Riddler provide card advantage and synergy with the deck's enchantments. Overall, the deck aims to be proactive and disruptive to control the tempo of the game.

This deck focuses on using ramp spells like Utopia Sprawl and Eldrazi Temple to quickly bring out powerful Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul and Sire of Seven Deaths. The deck also includes control elements like Kozilek's Command and Malevolent Rumble to disrupt the opponent's game plan. With a mix of ramp, control, and powerful creatures, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with massive threats while maintaining control of the game. Additionally, cards like Ugin, the Spirit Dragon and World Breaker provide additional utility and removal options to control the battlefield.

The deck focuses on utilizing Leyline cards and Leyline Binding to control the opponent's resources while establishing a strong board presence with powerful creatures like Scion of Draco and Omnath, Locus of Creation. Quantum Riddler and Helga, Skittish Seer provide additional control elements, while Force of Negation offers protection against opposing spells. The deck aims to slow down the opponent's game plan and outvalue them with a combination of control elements and high-impact creatures. The inclusion of Keruga, the Macrosage as a companion adds consistency to the deck's strategy.

This deck focuses on using Eldrazi creatures and ramp spells to control the game and overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats. By utilizing Eldrazi Temple and other ramp spells, the deck can quickly cast high-cost Eldrazi creatures such as Emrakul, the Promised End and World Breaker. Malevolent Rumble and Kozilek's Command provide additional control elements, while Ugin, Eye of the Storms can help wipe the board of opposing threats. Overall, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's plan while establishing a dominant board presence with its Eldrazi creatures.

This deck focuses on utilizing the Amulet of Vigor to generate extra mana and play multiple lands in a turn, allowing for explosive plays with Primeval Titan. The main goal is to assemble the Amulet Titan combo, which involves ramping up quickly to cast Primeval Titan and fetching lands like Vesuva and Tolaria West to further enhance the mana base and tutor for key pieces. The deck also includes cards like Scapeshift and Green Sun's Zenith to help find combo pieces and accelerate the win condition.
